definition: the cutting of or into body tissues or organs (especially by a surgeon as part of an operation), divide into segments
details:
noun
- the cutting of or into body tissues or organs (especially by a surgeon as part of an operation)
= synonyms: incision
- one of several parts or pieces that fit with others to constitute a whole object
= example: one of several parts or pieces that fit with others to constitute a whole object
= synonyms: segment
- one of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole
= synonyms: division
- a self-contained part of a larger composition
= example: a self-contained part of a larger composition
= synonyms: subdivision
- a segment of a citrus fruit
= example: a segment of a citrus fruit
- a specialized division of a large organization
= synonyms: department
- a small team of policemen working as part of a police platoon
- a small army unit usually having a special function
- a division of an orchestra containing all instruments of the same class
- a small class of students who are part of a larger course but are taught separately
= example: a small class of students who are part of a larger course but are taught separately
= synonyms: discussion section
- (geometry) the area created by a plane cutting through a solid
= synonyms: plane section
- a distinct region or subdivision of a territorial or political area or community or group of people
= example: a distinct region or subdivision of a territorial or political area or community or group of people
- a very thin slice (of tissue or mineral or other substance) for examination under a microscope
= example: a very thin slice (of tissue or mineral or other substance) for examination under a microscope
- a land unit equal to 1 square mile
verb
- divide into segments
= synonyms: segment
